data.title: Musicians Born on July 2
data.meta_description: Famous birthdays in music for the 2nd of July. See which composers, musicians, pop stars and rockers were born on July 2.
data.text:
Johann Staden, German baroque organist and composer, baptized in Free Imperial City of Nuremberg, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1634)

Guillaume van Messaus, Belgian composer, born in Antwerp, Dutch Republic (d. 1640)

Daniel Speer, German composer, born in Breslau, Habsburg Empire (d. 1707)

Christoph Willibald Gluck, Austrian composer (Il re pastore), born in Weidenwang, Electoral Palatinate, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1787)

François Léonard Rouwyzer, Dutch composer, born in Maastricht, Dutch Rebublic (d. 1827)

Hardenack Otto Conrad Zinck, Danish flautist, composer, choral director, and music educator (Blaagaard Seminarium, 1791-1811), born in Husum, Duchy of Schleswig (now Germany) (d. 1832)

Peter Ritter, German cellist and composer, born in Mannheim, Electorate of the Palatinate, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1846)

Antoine Prumier, French harpist and composer, born in Paris (d. 1868)

Thérèse Wartel, French pianist and composer, born in Paris (d. 1865)

Charles-Louis Hanon, French composer and piano pedagogue (The Virtuoso Pianist in 60 Exercises), born in Renescure, France (d. 1900)

Francesco Spetrino, Italian conductor and composer, born in Palermo, Italy (d. 1948)

Albert Szirmai, Hungarian operetta composer, born in Budapest, Hungary (d. 1967)

Jack Hylton, English orchestra leader and impresario (Crazy Passage Show), born in Great Lever, Lancashire, England (d. 1965)

Carl Weinrich, American organist, choral conductor, Baroque revivalist, and educator, born in Paterson, New Jersey (d. 1981)

Robert Levine Sanders, American composer, and organist, born in Chicago, Illinois (d. 1974)

Earl Robinson, American composer (Ballad for Americans; Preamble to Peace), and folk music singer-songwriter ("Joe Hill"'; "Black and White"), born in Seattle, Washington (d. 1991)

1910 William Douglas Denny, American composer, born in Seattle, Washington (d. 1980)

Frederick Fennell, American conductor (Time & Winds), born in Cleveland, Ohio (d. 2004)

"Sheikh" Imam [Eissa], Egyptian folk and protest singer-songwriter, born in Giza (d. 1995)

Genrikh Matusovich Vagner, Belarusian composer, born in Żyrardów, Poland (d. 2000)

Rick Besoyan, American singer, actor, playwright, composer and director (Little Mary Sunshine), born in Reedley, California (d. 1970)

Marvin Rainwater, American country singer (Ozark Jubilee), born in Wichita, Kansas (d. 2013)

Billy Usselton, American big band jazz saxophonist (Les Brown and His Band of Renown), born in New Castle, Pennsylvania (d. 1994)

1926 Lee Allen, American tenor sax player (Walkin' With Mr Lee), born in Pittsburg, Kansas (d. 1994)

Brock Peters [George Fisher], American actor and singer (Carmen Jones, To Kill a Mockingbird), born in New York City (d. 2005)

1927 Ruth Berghaus, German choreographer and opera director, born in Dresden, Germany (d. 1996)

Line Renaud [Jacqueline Ente], French pop and cabaret singer, actress, and AIDS activist, born in Pont-de-Nieppe, France

Ahmad Jamal [Frederick Jones], American jazz pianist, composer, bandleader and educator, born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania (d. 2023) [1]

David Lewin, American composer, born in New York City (d. 2003)

Gilbert Kalish, American pianist and professor (SUNY Stony Brook), born in Brooklyn, New York

Dee [David] Palmer, English keyboard player and composer (Jethro Tull, 1972-80), born in Hendon, London

Paul Williams, American baritone singer and choreographer (The Temptations - Cloud Nine), born in Birmingham, Alabama (d. 1973)

Stéphane Venne, French Canadian songwriter and film score composer, born in Verdun, Quebec

James Fulkerson, American composer of theatrical and electro-acoustic music, and trombonist, born in Streator, Illinois

Joe English, American musician and drummer (Wings; Sea Level), born in Rochester, New York

1949 Roy Bittan, American rock piano and accordion player (E Street Band), sometimes referred to as "The Professor", born in Queens, New York

Joe Puerta, American rock bassist (Ambrosia; The Range), born in Lomita, California [1]

Johnny Colla, American musician (Huey Lewis and the News), born in Sacramento, California

1952 Miklós Sugár, Hungarian conductor, classical and electro-acoustic composer, and music educator, born in Budapest Hungary

1952 Wayne Haner, American rock bassist (Axe, 1980-84 - "Heat in the Street"), born in the USA

Jeffrey Cooper, American R&B and funk guitarist (Midnight Star - "No Parking On The Dance Floor"; "Operator"), born in the USA

Mick Anker, British rock bass guitarist (Blow Monkeys - "Wicked Ways"), born in the UK

Martin Phillipps, New Zealand new wave singer-songwriter and guitarist (The Chills - "Heavenly Pop Hit", "Pink Frost"), born in New Zealand (d. 2024)

Dave Parsons, British rock bassist (Bush, 1992-2002 - "Swallowed"; Transvision Vamp), born in Hillingdon, England

Jenni Rivera

Mexican-American singer-songwriter (Jenni, 2008), born in Long Beach, California

Kevin Hearn, Canadian keyboardist, guitarist, and accordion player (Barenaked Ladies; Thin Buckle), born in Grimsby, Ontario

Colin Edwin, Australian progressive rock bassist, and guimbri player (Porcupine Tree), born in Melbourne, Australia

1970 Monie Love [Simone Gooden Johnson], English rapper ("It's a Shame (My Sister)") and US radio personality, born in Battersea, England

Rocky Gray, American rock drummer (Evanescence, 2003–27), and guitarist, born in Jacksonville, Arkansas

Erik Ohlsson, Swedish punk rock guitarist (Millencolin), and graphic artist, born in Orebro, Sweden

Diana Gurtskaya, Georgian-Russian pop singer, born in Sukhumi, Abkhaz, Georgian SSR, USSR

Michelle Branch, American singer-songwriter and guitarist ("All You Wanted"; The Wreckers), born in Sedona, Arizona

Ashley Tisdale

American actress and singer (High School Musical), born in Monmouth County, New Jersey

1985 Vincenzo Maltempo, Italian classical pianist (works of Charles-Valentin Alkan), and teacher, born in Benevento, Italy

Burna Boy [Damini Ogulu], Nigerian singer-songwriter (African Giant), born in Port Harcourt, Nigeria

Saweetie [Diamonté Harper], American rapper (My Type), born in Santa Clara, California
